summary: This bill, the Office of Gun Violence Prevention Act of 2025, establishes an Office of Gun Violence Prevention within the Department of Justice. The Director of the Office, appointed by the Attorney General, will coordinate gun violence prevention efforts across various DOJ divisions and federal agencies, evaluate existing programs, recommend policy changes, collect data, and conduct public education campaigns. The bill also mandates the formation of an advisory council to assist the Director and requires an annual report to Congress on gun violence and related policy recommendations.
